rev.comment: /* Post-classical anarchism */ This sentence is still bizarre, but it's a little better.
/* Post-classical anarchism */ 'Even'? What's wrong with Dora?
Realigning Kropotkin and Zerzan images to comply with MOS.
/* Individualist anarchism */ Actually, this paragraph is hideous in general. Replacing it with the one from the main article until I can think of something better to do.
/* Individualist anarchism */ Removing wacky multiple names. We have it at [[social anarchism]], so we should standardize it to that.
/* Free love */ Adding section on education.
/* Social anarchism */ Not a separate school on par with the other three.
/* Social anarchism */ Cutting down. Let's see how this works.
This looks really awkward, and adds too much detail to the intro. Removing.
anarchism without adjectives is certainly not a post-classical school
/* Anarchist communism */ left-align to balance Stirner above
/* Classical anarchism */ image choices: replace low-value syndicalist flag with portrait of Proudhon, swap Kropotkin images
split last paragraph into "Etymology and terminology" section per GA review suggestion
/* Russian Revolution */ explain [[White movement]], per GA comments
Then don't make it a subset. Made classical and post-classical anarchism equal in heading.
/* Fight against fascism */ revised "marked up numerous successful victories" per GA review comments

/* Historical / classical anarchism */ does not make sense to have "post-classical" as a subsection of "classical"; this section for all important schools of thought, without [[WP:WEIGHT|undue weight]].
/* Anarchism without adjectives */ no need for more than one paragraph here
/* External links */ rm divisions, two links which overlap with others. I have no strong preference which are included, just that they are high-quality, neutral in weight and fewer than ten.
/* Schools of thought */ This section is obviously ancient anarchism. Why is it being given so much attention over later anarchism?
/* External links */ removed wikiversity and wikinews links; not much there about anarchism
/* Post-classical schools of thought */ try to squeeze Zerzan in between sections
use the discussion page instead of blindly reverting please; this is a [[WP:SUMMARY|summary article]] which at 75kb is already much [[WP:SIZE|too long]]
/* Organized labor */ Returning, as it is nowhere named as a section specifically as historical, just "as a social movement".
/* Further reading */ rm "Anarchy as Order"; does not seem to be of the same stature as the others
/* External links */ anarchism sidebar already present; is the duplicate footer really needed?
/* External links */ one of mises+molinari should suffice

"free love" section is written ahistorically and so does not fit chronologically in the history section; should be included in [[anarchism and sex/love]] and [[issues in anarchism]] articles and summarised in that section here
/* Schools of thought */ relocate/replace Godwin image to prevent bunching
/* Post-classical schools of thought */ per talk, the Bey image is suspect; removed Zerzan and Rothbard earlier, restoring Zerzan now (feel free to change)
/* Egoism */ needs a brief mention here, has its own sub-article

/* Post-classical schools of thought */ moved outgrowth to appropriate sub-article; this section is intended to be a short summation of the relatively unimportant last fifty years of anarchist thought
moving section on "new anarchism" to the appropriate sub-article, [[contemporary anarchism]]
/* Social movement */ changed specially to especially
/* External links */ add www.anarchyisorder.org to links

/* Organized laboUr */ There seems to be a USAmerican bias towards the USA version of the FACT and the FACTS

/* Organized labor */ Amercanisms, and King O'Mallyisms do not wash. Its Labour not Labor.
/* Social movement */ Labour Movement began in Britain, Labor Movement links to Britain. In the 19th century and in the 21st century most people from around the world speak British English and not US
/* Social movement */ The Labour movement began in Britain.. Therefore British English should be used.
/* Organized labor */ The Labour movement began in Britain.. Therefore British English should be used.
not a stem, but a suffix
[[Help:Reverting|Reverted]] edits by [[Special:Contributions/174.124.221.56|174.124.221.56]] ([[User talk:174.124.221.56|talk]]) to last version by Graham87
contradictory; "anarchism" is a singular term. please discuss on talk
WP:DRNC / also, individualist anarchism was non-capitalist
the notion that anarchism is compatible with a free market economy is a fringe perspective
see [[WP:CONSENSUS]]; please discuss contentious edits on the talkpage
Lack of consensus not a reason to revert
undo contradictory edit; the point of the sentence is to introduce [[free market anarchism]] – no point in removing that link
/* Free Love */ section too short to merit image
/* Schools of thought */ not enough room for three images in this section; Godwin and Stirner left but feel free to pick another two
/* Individualist anarchism */ consolidate section headings to reduce bloat; no substantive content changes
/* Schools of thought */ sync summary order with main article
this lede is incoherent; too much packed into the opening line
revert changes made without consensus, rm inappropriate navel-gazing
changed "some time" to "always", per the source
[[WP:AWB/T|Typo fixing]], typos fixed: american → American using [[Project:AWB]]
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 329773625 by [[Special:Contributions/68.150.135.48|68.150.135.48]] ([[User talk:68.150.135.48|talk]]) I'd at least like an explanation for reverting an aesthetic change.
/* Post-classical schools of thought */ Trying to make this section less crowded looking.
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/163.153.138.136|163.153.138.136]] to last revision by Maziotis ([[Wikipedia:Huggle|HG]])

Consensus is to not include websites to specific branches. This section is for "general anarchism" (whatever that is). This link belongs to the "anarcho-capitalism" article (where it is already found)
Adding bit on free love, and remedying image overcrowding.
/* Individualist anarchism in the United States */ ?
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 327803581 by [[Special:Contributions/Eduen|Eduen]] ([[User talk:Eduen|talk]])then diiscuss it and stop edit warring. this is not the way to go about change, as you know
yes, no consensus. someone keeps erasing things i added.
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 327748608 by [[Special:Contributions/Eduen|Eduen]] ([[User talk:Eduen|talk]])Euden there is no consensus for this change. Stop edit warring and discuss it on the talk page.
someone keeps erasing schools of thought
well why should the previous version be the one that stays? come to the talk page
Saw the talk page--didn't see any consensus for the changes. Reverted.
Reverted to revision 325616439 by [[Special:Contributions/Nihilo 01|Nihilo 01]]; no consensus for such changes. ([[WP:TW|TW]])
again i didnt erase "anarcho" capitalism but other people did erase things like poste left anarchism, insurrectionary anarchism and post-anarchism
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 325330514 by [[Special:Contributions/VoluntarySlave|VoluntarySlave]] ([[User talk:VoluntarySlave|talk]])rv. take it to the talk. solcailst refers to individualistic form
Change back to "social anarchism" - the references provided are divided equally between the two terms, and [[social anarchism]] is a more complete article
This encyclopedia should reflect the majority and common use of concepts, describing things as what experts say they are and not as we users think should be. (check refferences)
Reverting to last revision by 4twenty42o + Eduen's last change. No real discussion of wholesale changes has happened.
again, all anarchism historiclly has been anticapitalist incluiding individualist mutualism. (therefore socialist) the correct term is social anarchism.
[[:en:User:NicoV/Wikipedia Cleaner/Documentation|WikiCleaner]] 0.98 - Repairing link to disambiguation page - [[Wikipedia:Disambiguation pages with links|You can help!]]
/* Post-classical schools of thought */ re-ordering alphabetically
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 324699626 by [[Special:Contributions/117.192.131.200|117.192.131.200]] ([[User talk:117.192.131.200|talk]]) not the best definition...
Who discusses this changes??? Under which references???. ALL the discussions and archives make a clear accord about the topics of this article.
/* Anarcho-capitalism */ re-adding *some* of the removed material. No reason for such wholesale removal without discussion.
argument being "changes were made to quickly"
/* As a social movement */ Let's expand this baby.
history should go before schools of thought. this actually shows the social relevance of each school of thought
"social anarchism" is the mayoritarian tendency and so deserves to go first
/* Individualist anarchism in Europe */ Too big
/* Post-classical schools of thought */ Ordering roughly by size.
a minority position both in time and space
i dont understan the "Free market" label. individualist anarchism in the usa was not just dedicated on economics
the issue here is not "hate" but reality
This "focus" could appear in the beginning
An already discussed issue [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Talk:Anarchism/Archive_59 with the same guy]... again an ancap hate campaing, and again, and again
social anarchism is the most appopiate and used term as individualist anarchism is also socialist (critic of capitalism)
individualist anarchism has also been anticapitalist except for so called "anarcho" capitalism
"new school" anarchists who dont explicitly adhere to anarcho comuunism also have this view
too much "anarcho" capitalism no reason why it has to have more than the other new currents
BOT adding link to [[WebCite]] archive of [[Encarta#Closure|soon to be defunct]] [[Encarta]] link(s)
/* Internal issues and debates */ changed a complex relationship to complex relationships
confusing having them right next to each other
move, shorten, and correct misspelling ... but I'm really not sure it belongs in the lead anyway
Noted that this article is not about a common "dictionary" definition of the term anarchism
Should wait till after talk page discussion.
/* Law and order and the use of violence */
Removed or replaced non-applicable protection template.
/* Anarcha-feminism */ changed picture to standard size in the article
Changed protection level of Anarchism: oops ([edit=sysop] (expires 11:27, 12 October 2009 (UTC)) [move=sysop] (indefinite))
Changed protection level of Anarchism: [[WP:PPOL#Content disputes|Edit warring / Content dispute]] ([edit=autoconfirmed] (expires 11:27, 12 October 2009 (UTC)) [move=sysop] (indefinite))

A vague appeal to "consensus" is no justification for reverting. If you explain your specific problems with the current version on the talk page, we can try and find out what the current consensus is.
Until the issues are agreed should be preserved until the final long time consensus.
Please stop arbitrarily reverting a large chuck of edits by multiple editors. Discuss this first, please. I'm removing what I think you're objecting too, but I'm not clear what you're upset about.
Hey!, I don't see in disscution the arguments about why post-modern forms of anarchy are more relevant than libertarian one, what I see is a disccution about a picture.

It doesn't matter what the old consensus is, as there seems to be a new one now. There were talk page discussions surrounding these changes, and nobody raised any objections. The ancap section is huge
/* Post-classical schools of thought */ this book could help
That edition haven't relationship with references, and all this change are against the old consensus.
Removed or replaced non-applicable protection template.
Changed protection level of Anarchism: Edit war appears concluded; trust editors in question not to re-engage ([edit=sysop] (expires 19:38, 5 October 2009 (UTC)) [move=sysop] (indefinite))

Changed protection level of Anarchism: Full protection: dispute, Edit war/content dispute. using [[WP:TW|TW]] ([edit=sysop] (expires 19:38, 5 October 2009 (UTC)) [move=sysop] (expires 19:38, 5 October 2009 (UTC)))
/* Post-classical schools of thought */ Compromise. I think we can both be happy with this.
Exactly. Except that I am not trying to exclude the more popular Rothbard from the article. There is a space for both, and I honestly believe that Rothbard is best included in the anarcho-capitalism
According to the exact same statistic site you are using, Rothbard gets more than twice as many visits as Zerzan.
Stop being childish. I actually think the article looks good, with appropriate and relevant information, this way. Stop trying to ban an author that, according to statistics, is one of the most visit
You can't use a double standard like that. I'm using the same method of determining popularity as you are, and Rothbard is more relevant by the standards YOU have been using..
/* Post-classical schools of thought */ added most recent popular post-classical author in the post-classical section
/* Post-classical schools of thought */ great picture for anarcho-capitalism
/* Post-classical schools of thought */ Rothbard gets at least three or four more visits then Zerzan. In fact, he's probably one of the busiest pages of any anarchist.
/* Post-classical schools of thought */ Having all these on the same side of the screen looks awful.
I agree that section is too crowed. Since John Zerzan receives three times more visits, without even being in this article, I am changing photo in post-classical section
/* Anarcho-capitalism */ I don't actually understand what this is support to cite. All it seems to be doing is saying Rothbard is the 'greatest anti-statist' or something of that nature. Confusing.
/* Post-classical schools of thought */ Green anarchist is pretty damn prominent.
/* Post-classical schools of thought */ More uniform style, it's a bit crowded with images down here, text is getting crammed together.
/* Anarcho-capitalism */ Undue weight given to a fringe group
/* Anarcha-feminism */ RV; green anarchism may have a picture of a prominent author, just as much as any other branch. Not your place to make such editorial decision
What about the note of "general anarchism"?. Please, next time pay attention to the notes.

standardize picture; I can't find any reference to the term "techno-positive", in relation to green anarchism, outside wikipedia. I am looking for notable sources on social ecology and green anarchism
[[WP:RBK|Reverted]] edits by [[Special:Contributions/69.29.215.212|69.29.215.212]] ([[User talk:69.29.215.212|talk]]) to last version by Maziotis
stats say otherwise (stats.grok.se/ & google.com); Anyway, historically "green anarchism" came with AP. This is pure prejudice for anti-civ ideas. See previous summary. Nothing to do with reality
/* Anarcha-feminism */ This is too crowded to begin with.

Bookchin repudiated anarchism (his pic should definitely have a place in the communalism article) Anyway, judging by wikipedia stats and others, AP is by far more popular and easily recognizable to GA

ordering mut. like a 'middle way' theory according to refs

not sourced and not true since there are anarchist that support compulsion including terrorism
